The following activities, which pose a greater epidemiological and sanitary risk, must comply, in addition to the protocols, recommendations and instructions of the national, provincial and Autonomous City of Buenos Aires sanitary authorities, the following conditions for their performance:    to. The group trips and graduates, students or similar , with the exception of those referred to in subparagraph b. Shall be authorized provincial jurisdictions destination and permanence. All members of the contingent must have a negative antigen test upon boarding. Upon return, the members of the contingent must:    i. Carry out an antigen test prior to boarding the return transport. If any of the diagnostic tests are positive, it should be coordinated with the local authorities to isolate the cases and their close contacts.  ii. Those people who do not have a complete vaccination scheme 14 days prior to the start of the trip, must carry out a 7-day isolation and, on their own, a new test that must be reported to the National Surveillance System by the laboratory. The control of the testing will be in charge of the travel company.  b. On retired and retired group trips, all members of the contingent must present a complete vaccination schedule that occurred at least 14 days prior to the start of the trip.    c. Activities in discotheques, dance venues or similar that take place in closed spaces, may use a maximum of 50% of the authorized capacity, except in cases where a lower capacity is expressly provided by current regulations. In addition, they must require those who attend these activities, a complete vaccination schedule that occurred at least 14 days before the activity.    d. Activities in party halls for dances, dances or similar that take place in closed spaces, may use a maximum of 50% of the authorized capacity, except in cases where a lower capacity is expressly provided by current regulations. In addition, they must require those who attend these activities, a complete vaccination schedule that occurred at least 14 days before the event, or a negative diagnostic test carried out no more than 48 hours in advance.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211215131156/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/salud/coronavirus/medidas-prevencion/generales/conducta

Opening of borders  As of November 1, 2021, the entry into the national territory of non-resident foreigners is restored, as long as they comply with current immigration and health requirements or those that are established in the future.  The entry of non-resident foreigners in the national territory will be carried out through the safe corridors established in the terms of article 16 of Decree No. 260/20 and complementary regulations, except for:    to. people who are affected by the transfer of merchandise by international trade operations of cargo transportation of merchandise, by air, land, sea, river and lake means;  b. carriers and crew of ships and aircraft;  c. the people affected by the operation of flights and medical transfers; Y  d. Persons duly authorized by the National Directorate of Migration, when there are special and accredited humanitarian reasons that warrant it, with the corresponding intervention of the national health authority and the Ministry of Foreign Relations, International Trade and Worship, in the terms established by the regulation.  According to Administrative Decision 1163/2021 , any person who comes from or has been in the African continent or in the affected areas defined by the national health authority in the last 14 days prior to entering the country, will be subject to compliance with the current immigration requirements:    to. Inform your Affidavit if you come from or if you have been in the affected areas defined by the national health authority in the last 14 days.  b. Have completed the vaccination schedule at least 14 days before entering the country.  c. Have a negative PCR test performed in the country of origin within 72 hours prior to entering the country.  d. Get an antigen test upon arrival in the country.  and. Carry out the quarantine provided for in article 7, paragraph d) of Decree No. 260/20 and its amending and complementary regulations, and perform a PCR test on the tenth day after taking a sample from the PCR test at origin, the result of which must be negative, as a condition of completion of mandatory isolation.  F. Those non-resident foreigners must also have a COVID-19 health insurance, with coverage of hospitalization services, isolation and / or medical transfers, for those who result in positive, suspected or close contacts.  https://web.archive.org/web/20211215131156/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/salud/coronavirus/medidas-prevencion/generales/conducta
